result.execSummary:
All charges against Brian J Walsh in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian J Walsh is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J Walsh

records.addlTxt: Filed by the State on behalf of the Victims.

9:03 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Brian J Walsh.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization.  State advises they have received proof of counseling/treatment and based on the victim's statements the State is moving to dismiss the case in its entirety.  No objection by Atty. LaVoy.  Court orders case dismissed on the State's motion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:51 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Brian J Walsh in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. LaVoy provides an update, he notes his client is still undergoing DV counseling.  Atty. LaVoy notes his client should finish counseling on October 17 so he is requesting a new plea and sentencing after that date.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:47 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Noah Buhle, for attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court.   Defendant Brian J Walsh did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Buhle provides an update, he is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:47 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court.   Defendant Brian J Walsh did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  State advises that the victims have waived notifications of further proceedings date, so the matter can proceed early today.  Atty. LaVoy provides an update, he is requesting one additional further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:23 AM Defendant Brian J Walsh in court with Attorney Jamie Pagac for Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
